revised_title: ATP Inhibition and Regulation of Smooth Muscle Calcium Channels
tldr: The authors discovered that ATP inhibits smooth muscle calcium channels, affecting their opening probability. This finding raises the possibility that the ubiquitous BK channel may play a role during pathophysiological events. The study demonstrates that ATP and cromakalim have similar effects on BK channels in different smooth muscle types, such as rabbit aortic, rabbit tracheal, and pig coronary artery.
